author: Lee N
title: Excellent care
body:
I attended Cannock Hospital for right knee medial meniscectomy via arthroscopy under general anesthetic.  
From start to finish, my care was excellent. Although I'm struggling to recall everybody's names (anesthetic!), the nurses (I remember Kate and Gemma) who took my information and looked after me in bed, who walked me to theatre (Phil, I think), the anesthesiologist with fantastic bedside manner (Dr Sharma, I think), the nurses in theatre and my surgeon Dr Senevirathna (who even called me that evening to check up on me and discuss my surgery).  
Everybody was fantastic, and I appreciate the care so much.

author: eagleyb89
title: Cataract surgery
body:
I had cataract surgery on one eye. The surgeon changed my eyesight and after the surgery there was an imbalance between my eyes. I was told I would have to have the other eye done to solve this problem. The surgeon did the same thing to my other eye and afterwards I was unable to see properly. The hospital finds this acceptable and states I was told of the risks.  
I will have to have further surgery to improve the situation after these two operations.  
This has severely affected my whole life.

author: jfsimon
title: Prostate Biopsy
body:
I was informed before the procedure by letter what would be happening. I was taken at the appointed time.  
Although the procedure is not pleasant, the nursing staff and doctor was very efficient and professional, continually reassuring me and asking if I needed a break.  
After the procedure my blood pressure dropped, so I had to stay an extra hour, but my wife was allowed to stay with me. We were given sandwiches and tea/coffee while we were waiting.  
Staff were brilliant and can’t praise them enough. My experience of the NHS in Scotland has been very good to date

author: Natalie90
title: Experience at children's A&E
body:
I arrived at A&E with my screaming baby, the place was extremely busy so we had a long wait as expected. I was told I was not allowed anyone in with me, which I was fine with, even though I witnessed several other patients allowed more than one person for no reasons, which was frustrating.  
When I was taken to the CDU I was finally allowed someone else in to help me with my baby, who was still screaming. Although when my second person approached the sleeping HCSW on the door at children's A&E, they told her she has to walk around to the main hospital to access CDU and not via the door I just went in. This was ridiculous, as it was the middle of the night.  
The lack of communication when waiting and after being reviewed was awful. My son was reviewed by a student nurse who did not introduce theirself, communicate anything they were doing, ask anything about my son's medication history, and tried to give further medication. I communicated these concerns already to a nurse on shift.  
I was asked about throat swabs on my baby to make sure his tonsillitis was not bacterial. I agreed. I have since received a text to tell me my baby's PCR was negative. I was not asked about any PCR test, I would have said no to this considering how much pain he was in and how many times his tonsils were examined. I already carried out an LFT prior to coming, which was negative. Nobody asked about covid.  
I would like to say that Dorothy is an absolute credit to the CDU. She could not have done enough for us, continuously checking in and offering support when my baby was continuously screaming in pain.

author: watermc75
title: My experience in Labour Ward
body:
I recently gave birth to a little boy, & just want to send a little message to say thank you to Kerry & her colleague (apologies, forgotten her name - baby brain) for such a pleasant experience with my first born.  
Both Kerry & her colleague made us feel comfortable & looked after us from the moment we left Ward 16 until we returned to Ward 16. They where both so supportive and encouraging during labour, not only to me but to my partner too.  
It was nice to have such encouragement during labour, and also for us to be advised on how the labour process was going.  
Positive birth story and very thankful, thank you!

author: petitregny
title: Discharged back to GP without explanation
body:
After suffering from painful urethritis/prostatitis, my GP referred me to Urology at Homerton Hospital. They performed a cystoscopy, which showed some irritation and a culture showing a bacteria.  
The consultant asked to see me again within 2 months (as stated in letter), but I had to wait 6 months for my follow-up telephone appointment. On the day on the telephone appointment 6 months later, I was waiting by the phone for the consultant to call, but the call never came through. They claim they tried to reach me, but my phone never rang. Maybe it was a network issue.  
As a result, I was discharged back to my GP without explanation or anyone talking me through the results. Now, with ongoing pain, I don't know what to do. Should I ask my GP to refer me back to the same service? I am really disappointed and upset at the lack of communication. I don't know what to do next.

author: Mumma bones
title: My son's care :-)
body:
We didn’t have to wait long to see Dr Matt in the hand clinic today, when we did he explained everything so well and spoke directly to my 14-year-old son. Often doctors talk to me and I encourage them to speak to my son, however today there was no need, as Dr Matt was engaging, person-centred, and his care was exemplary.  
We left feeling well cared for and very clear on future steps. Dr Matt was genuinely caring and passionate about our boy and treated him as an equal, which was a pure joy. X-ray was swift and staff were lovely. The best hospital visit we have had in many years, person-centred care in practice.

author: mols555
title: Great first appointment, but need better signage
body:
I took my daughter to her first CAMHS assessment in The Den, and once we were there the staff were lovely and greeted us with a warm welcome and the initial appointment went very well. We both had opportunities to talk on our own to the staff member and was given clear advice on what would happen next.  
My only feedback is that on trying to locate The Den we struggled to find it, a kind staff member saw us looking confused and showed us a short cut through a fire door. We found The Den but then the receptionist said we were in the wrong place, we need to go upstairs. I feel like some extra signage would have helped us.  
On leaving the appointment, we didn't know how to get back to the front of the hospital, so ended up having to walk around the whole hospital to get back to the front car park, which took about 20 mins. Some signs to direct us back through the hospital to main entrance would have been super helpful.

readBy.name: Chesterfield Royal Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

author: Ibytza
title: Lovely, dedicated medical staff
body:
Today, I've attended the Pre-Assessment Clinic at Kirkcaldy Hospital. I had a very nice experience, beginning with the lady at the main entrance, who was patiently guiding all the visitors.  
Once I've arrived at the Pre-Assessment Suite, I was kindly welcomed by the receptionist, who guided me to the waiting room. I was pleasantly surprised by the kindness and the care from nurse Tracie, towards not only me but all the patients in the waiting room. This lovely lady also has a very light touch when taking blood, so fear not! She is a busy bee, constantly on the move.  
Patience and professionalism is how I can refer to nurse Laurie, who talked me through all the information I needed for my surgical procedure, being very knowledgeable and helpful. A lot of morale support. Thank you Laurie!  
The gentleman at ECG, outpatients 4, unfortunately I'm not sure about his name, also very professional and kind.  
Lovely, dedicated medical staff. NHS can be proud of them.

author: Firefly67
title: Harsh attitude and lack of communication skills actually ruined the experience
body:
When me and my wife attended our 20 weeks scan, we were greeted by the radiographer at the Maternity Day Assessment Ward at Wishaw Hospital. Once the scan began, my wife asked the radiographer if they were able to talk us through each part of the scan as they were taking photos, and with a snippy tone the radiographer asked if we could give them a minute, which set the tone for the rest of the scan. The radiographer seemed as if the whole process was an inconvenience, and lacked the usual communication skills that other NHS staff have in abundance.  
My wife had also been showing early signs of pelvic girdle pain, so when she was being scanned the radiographer asked if she was Ok, as she had winced a little. My wife replied yes and mentioned the pain, and the radiographer's first concern was to make it clear they weren't pushing hard, which wasn’t what was insinuated at all. While the radiographer did all parts of the scan as expected, the harsh attitude and lack of communication skills actually ruined the experience a bit for me and my wife.  
The radiographer, in a monotone voice, asked if we were ready to hear the gender, then continued to give us our news in the same monotone way, expressing no joy or happiness for us. In contrast with the 12 weeks scan at the same place, where the radiographer was so helpful and reassuring, a totally opposite experience.

author: marchhx34
title: Appointment to start PrEP treatment
body:
The doctor and nurse put me at ease straight away and were both very friendly and funny. They explained everything to me in great detail and I felt very informed before I decided to go ahead.  
Brilliant experience, and won't be nervous next time.

author: circinusfk46
title: Excellent service and care
body:
The service and genuine care from Kenny on Dermatology Reception to fix appointments and his delightful, helpful manner is an ideal example of customer / patient service.  
We need more with his attitude.  
I would also like to praise Dr Mitchell, Dermatology Consultant, for her open, friendly and clear analysis together with easily understood explanations of treatments. She makes you feel so at ease.  
We are proud to tell our friends of the excellent service at our local hospital.

author: Skulls
title: Community treatment team
body:
I was recently put in contact with the Community Treatment Team (CTT) at Ashington. After having a traumatic experience with a different CTT, I now have experienced the same from yet another.  
I had gone to appointment's but I was then a missing person so obviously I couldn't attend them one's. I had tried from the start of being put in contact with the CTT to tell them so many times what help I would require, yet all the two people did was ask me again and again. They didn't seem to want to do anything but ask me that and make small talk about things that were not necessary to the conditions that I suffer from which they would be more than aware of.  
What these people at this service do is get you to go through everything that they know about as it's in health notes, they try to make out they don't know this to just drag out appointments to suit them. You can't ask them anything and when you do they will on nearly every occasion avoid answering you it's no wonder you get frustrated with them.  
They will try to give you pieces of paper that are of no use to you about your physical health when I know about that and I explained to them I have it already. They also want you to talk about things that you don't want to but you feel pressured. The way that they present themselves to the patients needs improvement, the way that they make small talk needs improvement in fact so much needs improving but nothing improves. Then all they do is discharge you before even getting any treatment, it's ridiculous amongst other things.  
What is the point in them.

readBy.name: Cumbria, Northumberland, Tyne and Wear NHS Foundation Trust

author: cetusxb55
title: Attending for a blood test
body: Attended to provide a sample of blood for testing. I arrived shortly before the appointment time and seen within 5 minutes. The nurse confirmed the reason for my visit and I rolled up my sleeve for the blood sample to be taken. The nurse applied the equipment and was able to take the sample without difficulty. I was then allowed to leave after confirming that I was okay.

author: BRbossa
title: Trying to secure help for my son
body:
A woeful tale of my dealings with the CAMHS team South who belong to Nottinghamshire Healthcare.  
I have tried to secure the assistance of CAMHS for two years for my primary school aged son who has been diagnosed with ASD and ADHD. My son is presenting with severe anxiety, low mood and suicidal thoughts.  
I have been referred by my GP - rejected, Community Paediatrician- rejected, and finally self referred him on a mission as we were desperate for help.  
This time made it as far as the assessment, the practitioner in CAMHS was very rude, I felt them to be full of self importance and furthermore stated that Nottinghamshire Healthcare NHS Foundation trust are not commissioned to deal with mental health that results from a neurological condition. They also backed this up saying my son is not capable of working with them - despite the fact they never tried.  
This is no game show this is my sons life, CAHMS said oh he won’t try and kill himself at his age but to make sure any hazards are locked away as he could do it by accident. CAHMS said if he’s that bad take him to accident and emergency - is this the expert medical opinion of Nottinghamshire Healthcare or just a few individuals?  
We saw three different practitioners none who we felt were qualified to diagnose, only whom were able to point to a pathway ie low mood, anxiety with the agreement of a follow up MDT team (most who have not met my son)  
So fast forward in the same month, my son is rejected by CAHMS I have now secured him an appointment this month (the same month) with a qualified doctor at Great Ormond Street psychiatry Department whom agreed my son has complex neurological and mental health issues and needs urgent help. My sons presentation is the same but I actually got a medical opinion.  
I feel they have used covid, lack of funds, patient back logs all as excuses. Nottinghamshire Healthcare are not lacking funding, I feel they need a complete reorganisation and they need to train/recruit qualified staff that want to help children and not look for reasons not too. It seems to me that their team ask why shall we reject this child and not what can we do to help.  
To those parents out there like me do not loose hope, keep fighting because your children are precious and they need you to advocate for them. I say don’t accept no for an answer, get informed look at the NICE guidelines and learn your child’s right under the NHS legalisation and take complaints higher if you have to.  
All I know is that I have now secured help for my son, I have to travel to London and this battle with Nottinghamshire Healthcare had given me a terrible journey that has affected my mental health, all un-necessary.

title: ....... lean on me ..... when you're not strong .…
body:
The words above reflect what the whole team of people do every day, and night, at QE. Right across the board, at all levels. All the time. 
The words are from a song by BIll Withers, an American singer/songwriter with a lot of stuff to his credit. He died a couple of years back, but his words and music not only endure but are relevant in many settings. My recent 'stay' at QE is one.
I presented to A&E on Mon 17 Oct and was discharged Thurs eve on the 20th. I had cellulitis and stayed in the Day Care Unit. All the people there are quietly amazing, a real team who are part of other teams who are like wise. A&E doctors and nurses, porters, thru to the Day Care Unit with visiting doctors, Consultants etc. 
Lying there with a drip in my arm, not too mobile, with little to do but watch and listen 24/7 to the workings and 'industry' of what goes on, see the tasks undertaken, and also the way & the how it goes. That is with complete professionalism, always on the look-out  for something not right, that all is always 'right'. All the time. On the 'look-out' for me!
Some more of the words go'.... if there is a load you have to bear, that you can't carry, I'm right up the road, I'll share your load, if you just call me ...' 
That's the sentiment I saw from them to me. And of course others.
On leaving I said I would write and tell them 'Thanks', and so I hope you can transmit this accordingly. Up on a Notice Board for all to see, and maybe persuade some to listen to the song by
 Bill Withers (it's an easy-listening piece that they might identify with. That's it. Please say 'Thanks'.
Martin

author: Gizmo3
title: Dermatology Ward 25 Ulster Hospital
body:
I attended an appointment at Dermatology Outpatients Department, Ward 25 at The Ulster Hospital. A very kind young man called Adrian (HCA) was professional and kind, he introduced himself and saw I was anxious about this appointment. He was so reassuring and supportive, explaining my appointment, which I was very grateful of at the time. Adrian spoke so kindly to me and my wife with dignity and respect.  
I am most grateful of the care and support that I received that day in Dermatology Ward 25, the service was amazing . Thank you for the great service and kindness I was given while I was there, attending this appointment at Dermatology.  
The staff are amazing, from the moment you walk into the department, from receptionist Tammy and Adrian the healthcare assistant, to all the nurses and doctors. Thank you.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Nursemummy28
title: Coil removal
body: The lady and gentleman I saw today were kind, caring, considerate, acted with dignity, speedy and professional. Could not fault the service at all. Thank you

author: pavokn83
title: Poor attitude towards family
body:
My family and I were visiting my dying grandmother in AMRU at Monklands NHS Hospital.  
The incident in question happened when we were contacted to say that my grandmother would pass that day, so my family and I visited the ward to spend time with my grandmother during her final hours. We were approached by a senior staff member in an aggressive manner to tell us that due to some policy, we were not all allowed to be in the room with my dying grandmother. I challenged this by stating that they showed no empathy and that their manner was very unprofessional.  
Later on when I approached this staff member to ascertain their name so that I could make a complaint, again I found the response to be dismissive and unprofessional.  
I have since spoke with a Senior Staff Nurse about my concerns.  
I would hope not to have another relative in this ward, as I would not wish this kind of treatment for anyone.

author: Air1111
title: Covid and flu vaccination
body:
My appointment was late in the day, there was quite a queue and things were running a bit late. When it came to my turn the practitioner was tired, I could tell, but just so nice and helpful. I said to her they must get fed up repeating the same script over and over again, but she smiled and said no, but she was just exhausted.  
What a team! Keeping going under such enormous pressure, doing a job which may seem like a thankless, repetitive task, but please take it from me - you are really and truly appreciated.

author: falconrb55
title: Surgery day case
body: Surgery day case, wonderful welcome, Naomi and Holly were caring and very professional, many thanks to all

author: BMW1300
title: Dynamic flow test
body:
The team at Victoria Hospital Urology Dept made a difficult day so much less stressful, I really want to thank them for turning what could have been an undignified experience into a positive outcome.  
I left there knowing what is happening with my body and what the procedure is going to be to try putting things right.  
I've been trying for 5 years to get to this point, so I can't express enough how grateful I am to finally know I have a good chance that my life might turn around, in a good direction.

author: paparc86
title: Not able to see a doctor
body: I asked to book an appointment with the doctor to have my implant removed due to a health concern, so I rang to request this and was denied and appointment as they said I needed to have a phone appointment with the nurse first. I agreed, but the earliest appointment was 4 weeks away and then cancelled the night before and rebooked for another 2 weeks. I spoke with my GP and tried to find somewhere else to have the implant removed but this service is the only one that does it, so I’ve suffered with a health issue for 6 weeks because they won’t book me a doctors appointment. I don’t even need a reason to have the implant removed, but I’m being forced to sit on the waitlist for a phone appointment that I don’t even want before they will consider booking me a doctors appointment to have it done, suffering the whole time

author: footballrp89
title: Very good experience with service
body:
Medicines Adherence Pharmacist (BASCT)  
I had a very good experience with this service I found it very helpful. I most needed this service and was grateful for it.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Thankful2022
title: They are absolute heroes
body:
I would like to thank the absolutely incredible staff at the QEUH for saving my life and the life of my son. I was cared for by both Obstetrics and the General Surgical team, and the care I received throughout was exceptional and patient-centred. I honestly can't praise everyone enough.  
Maternity Assessment was my first port of call, and they quickly diagnosed what likely was happening (they were right). The staff were so kind and reassuring. Over the next 5 days I was in various wards - Labour, Post -Labour and Ward 48. Every single staff member I encountered was supportive and delivered incredible care. It was an extremely scary situation for me and my family, and both ward staff and consultants went above and beyond in helping keep my pain under control, monitoring my then unborn son, and explaining everything to me.  
I had surgery, in which the incredible Obstetrics team delivered my son via c-section, and then in a very unusual situation, General Surgery took over to complete a second surgery. While I had a double surgery, the experience was so positive. Everyone introduced themselves pre-surgery, and while I was terrified, I felt in extremely safe hands. I had a spinal for the c-section, and the team did this to give me as positive a birth experience as possible.  
This meant the world to me as I got to hear my son cry, see him, hold him on my chest and kiss him before I was put under general anaesthetic for the rest of the surgery. The way the obstetric and surgical team got together to make this happen was truly incredible. They not only put our health first, but also my mental well-being. Everyone involved in my surgery - both in organising and those actually in the room - are absolutely wonderful professionals.  
After surgery I was in High Dependency and the staff there are just amazing. The level of care was outstanding. From taking my vitals and endless cannulas (my body was over having them), they helped me recover so much quicker with their care and kindness. This included helping my son come over and see me, and once I was well enough, helping make it possible to go to the Special Baby Unit at the other side of hospital to see my baby. Ward 9C was also fantastic, with staff supporting the final days of my care.  
I am not sure I've done everyone justice with my words. They are absolute heroes and the pride of NHSGGC. I can't say thank you enough, but I will never forget how well I was looked after.  
I'd also like to thank the staff in Special Baby who cared for our son.  
I am sorry if I have missed anyone - I was in a lot of pain and on a lot of drugs, so please forgive me if I have - but here are some of the staff members I would like to praise and thank:  
Surgeon:  
Miss Maeda  
Obstetrics surgeons:Dr Metcalf Dr Richmond  
Consultants:  
Miss Moyes  
Mr Knight  
Anaesthetists:Lynne and Ms ClarkeMidwife in surgery:SiobhanHigh Dependency:  
Hannah  
Orla  
Bridget  
Cath  
And many more ...  
Ward 48:  
Jill  
Joanne  
Steph  
Katie  
Collett  
Donna  
Robyn  
Catherine  
Julie  
Helen  
Special Baby:  
Laura  
Stacey

author: Greatfullpatient
title: Leeds health and well being service / IAPT
body:
I am absolutely over the moon with the care I received from IAPT.  
Stephen was exceptional from start to finish, excellent professionalism and explanations of everything. Steve took time to get to know me and my problem, he explained things through analogies and set tasks between sessions, which really helped my progress.  
I feel Stephen went above and beyond with my care, even organising to go to the place where the event occurred to make sure I had moved on.  
I can not thank Stephen enough for his outstanding expertise and listening ear.  
I would recommend this service

author: Rumana
title: Made my assessment easy and comfortable
body: I am a very anxious patient, although received many treatments in the past few years. I attended the pre-operation assessment clinic yesterday. Due to anxiety, my blood pressure was very high. There were two nurses, Linda and Rachel, who made my assessment easy and comfortable. They were very friendly and explained everything regarding what to expect on the day of my operation. I felt so confident after the assessment that I could go through this operation and everything will be fine. There are so many good angels around who all make our cancer journey easy. Thank you, Linda and Rachel.

author: loveef76
title: Stopping smoking
body: I took part in the smokefree hull and the experience was very good

author: ColinE
title: Excellent care from every member of staff
body: I'm not a frequent visitor to hospital, five visits in 50 years and one of those was the day I was born, so I don't have a lot to compare to, but the visit this week was pretty unique. From the moment I arrived I was cared for, I never felt like a number or 'just another patient' it made the experience so much easier and dare I say it almost enjoyable. The nurse in charge of my care Caithlin was truly exceptional, a credit to herself, her profession and the hospital, but I had excellent care from every member of staff I encountered; I just could not get all their names.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Jeanjeannie
title: Patient care
body:
I was admitted to Ward 10 at the Victoria Hospital, Kirkcaldy, for foot surgery. From pre-assessment, pre-op care in the ward, my experience in theatre and post-op care in the ward, I can only say it was exceptional.  
The staff were kind, compassionate and caring. Although quite a minor procedure, it was painful and staff were very understanding, even when I had a wee drama moment of feeling faint and nauseous.  
I cannot remember all the staff's names, but Carl from theatre and Fran (I think), really everyone was so professional and caring. I was dreading the procedure, but all the staff made it so much easier. Please keep up the exceptional work you all do.

author: Gardener68
title: Hysteroscopy experience
body: I had to have a hysteroscopy yesterday due to a recent post menopausal bleed. I was quite anxious about it but the team were so kind and professional that they made the whole thing a positive experience. I was really reassured and not embarrassed at all. I cannot thank everyone enough for their care and patience.

author: apuswr89
title: Loss of balance and falls
body:
OT  carried out  the trip hazard survey promptly arranged delivery of back door step; bath and toilet seat, walker, installation of stair hand rail. 
Showed me physiotherapy exercises  to strengthen my legs together with diagrams etc.
 I felt more happier and confident because she listened gave useful advice.

author: firech57
title: A check up
body: Very relaxed, the staff and nurses were very polite and helpful.

author: Craig13
title: Eye treatment
body: Every one at the eye unit at Treliske was brilliant, from reception right through to the (I’m not sure on the correct term - sorry) Optometrist/Eye Specialist I saw. Louisa was amazing, so kind, attentive and all around brilliant. The care I received, and the treatment I received was perfect. The NHS really are incredible, and the people I was seen by, and cared for today, are a credit to the NHS.

title: Very poor blood test
body: Came to have a prebooked blood test, I couldn't understand the phlebotemist who was very agitated, said to lean back , I couldn't as I have a bad back, then said breathing on her ?? At my practice was told blood tests had been lost !! Really poor service!

readBy.name: Royal Free London NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great Practice
body: Was recommended this practice and I made the right choice, very friendly staff! Such a great practice :)

title: Worth a little wait.
body: Paediatrician was very attentive and thorough. Had to wait a little but l didn’t mind given the wonderful service. Thank you.

readBy.name: Avon and Wiltshire Mental Health Partnership NHS Trust

title: Wonderful caring staff at Dorrington & Bayston…
body: Whenever  I go I feel well cared for. I have recently had to contact the surgery on 3 occasions. Each time the response has been professional,  warm and very efficient. The whole team are first class.  Many of my friends are envious of the quality of care that I report to them. Thank you all.

author: Louise74
title: Excellent care for my daughter
body: The care from the Emergency Department at RCHT was fantastic. My daughter was very anxious about a procedure that was needed, but the nurse and doctors were quick to respond, caring and very reassuring. Thank you.

author: Rumana
title: They've made this journey easier
body: I was diagnosed with cancer in 2018. The secretary (Shona, ENT department, Royal Infirmary, Aberdeen) of my surgeon and endocrinologist has made this journey easier since diagnosis till now. I am going for an operation again in December for another tumour and she has helped with all the communications (questions I had) with my surgeon and endocrinologist. I strongly feel the exceptional service and care provided by Shona should be praised and highlighted here. Thank you Shona.

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

title: Cancer triaging
body: For a couple of weeks, my partner hasn’t managed to get a GP appointment for the growing lump on his hand. So with increasing concern he went to a private clinic in Leeds. He was sent for an X ray and then an MRI and the conclusion is it’s a tumour. He now needs a referral to the Sarcoma MDT in Leeds however we still can’t get a GP appointment to do this urgent referral. We have finally managed to send the scan and reports through to them (receptionists couldn’t locate them for a while) but have been told no doctors are available but a doctor would be available next week. She then said we should call back again tomorrow to see if any are free. This is hugely stressful given the tumour is likely to be cancerous and we need to move as quickly as we can. My partner was also met with a great lack of empathy and understanding from the receptionist. I work very closely with the NHS so I understand the huge pressures staff are under but the process for a potential cancer patient has been utterly appalling and extremely upsetting. He hasn’t seen a GP in years and is not a strain on the system, but the lack of regard and help has been truly astounding. The process has surprised me as generally the practice he always been flexible when it’s with regards to my children.

title: Just what you hope a practice should be.
body:
The surgery had enough parking and was very clean and welcoming.  

Reception staff went above and beyond what could have been expected.

title: Great service
body:
I was told I could bring my 90 year old neighbour into the practice for help with online access. The It manager was available immediately to help and talk through the system. Thank you to the staff who made this happen. 
Whilst in reception the desk was very busy but no one waited long and all staff were polite and courteous. 
Thank you to all the staff who work so hard at the practice, we do appreciate you.

author: Lexie22
title: They went over everything
body: I was in the Surgical Day Bed Unit yesterday for Cataract Surgery and would like to say every one of the Nurses was great. They went over everything with me in detail so that I was relaxed for my surgery. Thanks VOLH.

title: Unprofessional staff
body: I came in today almost 32 weeks pregnant with severe pain in my tummy. I had been in previous to this appointment and had been diagnosed with spd. I was told by nurses that if i was concerned about anything, had any pains etc, to call in and come in if instructed. So i went in today with pain completely different to spd and wanted to ensure it was nothing serious. The first thing one of the nurses said to me was 'you need to just get on with it, ' as she had seen me for my last visit. She was extremely unprofessional and i was made to feel as though i was wasting their time.

author: woody99
title: No care or respect for me
body:
I was seen by a health practitioner at the end of October, and I was absolutely appalled by the service I received. There was no level of care, the staff member that I saw was rude and made me feel as if I was a burden. I was being seen as I had a lot of pain in my throat, they shoved a lolly stick around my mouth and was very rough with me. They knocked my teeth and this was sore, there was no apology.  
They were very rude and abrupt when they spoke to me. They also wished to sound my chest, so they moved my clothing away and my back bra strap without asking if this was okay. This made me feel uncomfortable further.  
The whole appointment was a disaster, and the practitioner made me feel silly and as if I was completely wasting their time. I wish I had said something at the time, but I was just so shocked by what I had experienced. I left my appointment feeling even worse.  
In my view, the practitioner that I had seen certainly has no understanding of NHS values. They had no care or respect for me, and certainly no compassion.

title: Very poor phone appointment  bookings
body:
Very disappointed with appointment bookings I had to wait 1hour 51 mins for someone to finally answer my phone. 
No issues with The doctors and all members of staff at this surgery as they all are doing great job and I have always been pleased with the care I received at this surgery.
The only problem being phone appointment bookings time this needs seriously addressed and sorted.

title: Excellent Dr
body: I attended an appointment at the mole clinic and saw such an amazing Gp ( unfortunately, I had to edit my review as was not allowed to name him, which is a shame) - he was so kind, listened and took the time to answer all my other queries and questions ( I came with more than one!) He is absolutely amazing, this is what GP care is all about - Thankyou

author: SJJ
title: Lowest standard of care
body:
I am emailing to make you aware of my dissatisfaction about the standard of care provided on ward 5B during my loved one’s stay. I feel it important to provide this information and that it will be beneficial for staff reflection.  
Whilst visiting my loved one, he appeared confused and was having low blood sugar readings. He was unable to recognise my husband when he arrived.  
His condition worsened and the next day he was hypoglycaemic again. I had said to an auxiliary that he was shaky and confused and I was told that he was like that because he has been sleeping all day and he had not eaten or drank anything.  
The next day, when I visited he was unresponsive, when I alerted his nurse, I was advised that they thought he was responsive. I said he was not. He was hypoglycaemic and the nurse came to rub gel into his gums. I said he is very unwell and he is deteriorating fast. At that the nurse held both their hands up and said with urgency (I felt, to stop me in my tracks) that they weren't his nurse today and that the nurse looking after him was on their break and would be back soon. They stated they were only there to administer the glucose gel as they were the only one there that could give it at that time.  
I persisted with the nurse, because they knew my loved one and must see that he had deteriorated massively . They replied that they had reported that that morning and they went back to their daily duties with their own patients. I felt the nurses manner was totally inappropriate and very disconcerting.  
The staff knew he was insulin dependant diabetic and he was not eating and they did not arrange for him to have any fluids or encourage sips for hydration.  
A lovely nurse came to speak with me the same day and said that they were trying to get my loved one a medical bed in 2F and that he would be transferred as soon as they could get a bed.  
Another nurse was also very concerned about my loved one's condition and expressed their condolences that he wasn't his usual self. They were really lovely and empathetic .  
The next visit, I pressed the emergency buzzer as my loved one seemed to be taking a turn? A stroke? He was unresponsive at this stage but looked distressed as if he had secretions and was going to be sick. His left eye was rolling to the top of his head. I was extremely alarmed and concerned.  
Three nurses arrived quickly and were debating whether this was a “peri” and whether they should put a call out.  
I said frantically he needs a doctor now, he has had an incident. One nurse replied that they had been trying to get a doctor all morning (it was afternoon at this point) and they were aware of his condition.  
I was frantically saying that they needed to put out a call urgently, they need to know he is having an acute incident now. I was very distressed. The nurse left and called an Advanced Nurse Practitioner (ANP).  
The ANP took the time after their examination to say that they have taken bloods and they didn’t think he had had a stroke but that they were to request an urgent CT scan. They were caring in their manner.  
I feel that the ward staff in 5B all knew my loved one very well and they did nothing in the early stages to raise alarm regarding his deteriorating condition within a 48-72 hr period.  
It makes my heart so heavy to have to say that my loved one passed away in ward 2F following a 10 day stay (following emergency transfer from 5B).  
I know 5B is a boarding ward and as such, is restricted in numbers of registered staff but I feel my loved one's condition could have been managed more appropriately and his deterioration should have been escalated about three or four days earlier.  
The nurse's unfortunate manner that day has stuck with me and I feel that they could have done more to escalate the situation. I felt their manner was abrupt and non-caring.  
He was left overnight and unresponsive in a 6 bedded area which I feel is highly inappropriate.  
I appreciate the demands on staff and the lack of registered staff on 5B due to the nature of the ward but he must have been the sickest patient there that day! I was alarmed at the dismissive attitude of the nurse when they held their hands up and said they were just there to give the glucose gel. I am the only one that can give it.  
This saddens me. It would only have taken a moment to show a bit of empathy and appreciation for my level of concern. More so because they knew him so well and also they knew me due to my numerous visits to ward 5B through the year.  
Perhaps there could be a reflection on this and consider the manner shown and the escalation process of a sick and deteriorating patient. I appreciate that the nurse was not his named nurse that day but they knew him so well and had recognised that he was sick. My grievance is their manner and lack of compassion shown when I was obviously distressed and alarmed at my loved one's worsening condition.  
This ward is clearly very busy and seemed to be unable to seek medical staff in such an acute and deteriorating patient. I feel very unhappy with the care provided to my loved one in the 72 hrs prior to his transfer to ward 2F.  
His death was inevitable as he had many medical conditions, but a little care and compassion and recognition of deterioration would have gone a long way and made his death more bearable for us loved ones.  
I wish to express my sincere thanks to one of your nurses support and compassion in the immediate transfer period. They helped us a lot.

title: Very good practice
body: The service I received today when I went for my flu and covid vaccinations was excellent.  The receptionist was very helpful and I wasn't kept waiting for anymore than 5 minutes.  Once called in the nurse was very thorough in explaining everything to me regarding the vaccinations and over I was extremely satisfied with the service.

title: Great service and info from doctor
body: Did take 2 weeks to get appointment but overall 6 weeks due to not knowing doctors can make appointments via a call consolation, was treated brilliantly by the doctor he gave great and informative information and has referred me but insisted that I follow up if what he says doesn't happen, I would like to see the old pre covid way of being able to book in to see a GP please

author: Sandav
title: Website inaccuracy
body:
A good friend is in St Mark's Hospital. We went to visit him yesterday. The link to the hospital on the Central Middlesex webpage shows the hospital to be in Harrow. We went to Harrow, but he was not there, he was in St Mark's at Acton Lane.  
On enquiry, it seems that the main part of St Mark's is now in Acton, but this is not shown on your website. Apart from having to pay for two expensive car parks, we were only able to spend a very limited amount of time with our friend once we had driven all the way from Harrow.  
May I please ask for you to clarify the locations of St Mark's Hospitals on your website, so that others do not suffer the same problem as us. It was extremely stressful.

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

author: TeeTee88
title: Contraception
body: I had to wait almost 45 minutes to be seen, but once I was there were no issues and the doctor was brilliant.

title: Safe and re-assuring
body: During this instance of my interaction with the surgery I have been greatly reassured by the thorough after care performed, whereupon doctors have repeatedly mare follow up calls to check my status and prompt me to progress sample submissions which in turns reduces the risk of non diagnosis of any serious condition.

author: gemini60
title: Hospital Care
body:
I attended Wishaw General Hospital for an Endoscopy / Colonoscopy.  
I received first class treatment from nurses Laura / Gwen, from the anaesthetist Lorraine and her team, and from Mohammed and Dr Gumbar. Many thanks for the care you took of me.

author: Hartwell
title: Balance assessment
body: Fine, assessment and review good. Therapy not required.

author: shudderqs64
title: Frustrating experiences
body:
Difficult to book appointments, long ques due to appointments being offered on the day only. Often queue number 38-39 roughly 1 hr, sometimes the call gets disconnected.  
Had to go the practice 3 times to collect 1 form which the GP was supposed to leave for me. Old school practice no online appointment booking.  
Doctors I have seen are okay, as well as the paramedic.  
Receptionists- some of them nice, some of them rude.  
After my previous GP practice, this one is a big disappointment.

author: planeoldme78
title: Another visit, another great result
body: Just visited with Lorraine. So reassuring. So motivational. I don’t feel as though I have no hope. Any promises made here I know will be followed up on.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: cafehr38
title: I phoned The Neaman Practice to get an appointment.
body: I phoned the surgery this week and spoke to Corine. She was really helpful, friendly and understanding. I was able to get an appointment without delay.

author: Shelleyubet53
title: Gratitude and respect!
body:
I am overwhelmed with the wonderful care I received from walking into reception to leaving!  
Having been a little concerned due to breast pain in both breasts and past breast problems, the care and advice I received was incredible!  
The doctor was amazing and reassured me after my initial examination I had nothing to worry about!  
I was then sent for a mammogram almost straight away, the nurse was wonderful and explained that the results will be through straight away.  
I then waited to see the doctor again to discuss my results! The doctor then explained my symptoms and again reassured me that the results from my mammogram were fine! He was absolutely lovely, he advised me what to take for the pain, but more than anything he didn't treat me like a time waster for worrying about nothing, he totally agreed that I'd done the right thing, especially with my past experiences and having breast cancer in the family. This was the biggest thing I was worried about, wasting the doctor's time and worrying about nothing, but I was soon made to feel completely comfortable and understood!  
Every single person at the Rose Clinic treated me with respect and were absolutely lovely, this made the whole experience so much easier!  
I am forever grateful to you all, thank you so very much!  
With Gratitude and Respect!  
Xxxxxx💙🙏

readBy.name: Lancashire and South Cumbria NHS Foundation Trust

title: Test Results
body: Review:  I spoke with a super lady today regarding my test results. Lovely to speak to a person who was so customer orientated as it is not always the case at the surgery however I do totally appreciate how very busy they are and how hectic it must be.

author: cricketgh44
title: They made the experience a lot less stressful
body: After having some issues with my period, the doctor and I came to the conclusion that I should get my coil changed a year early. After a really difficult initial insertion, it’s not an overstatement to say I was terrified. I attended the sexual health clinic in Aberdeen Health Village and I had a much better experience. We spoke about my previous experience and Dr Cook assured me that it wouldn’t necessarily be the same this time. I was offered local anaesthetic which I didn’t get last time and I felt comfortable speaking up when I started to feel a bit unwell. Dr Cook created a calm, controlled atmosphere during the procedure and it made that entire experience a lot less stressful. I’m incredibly grateful to have had a much more positive experience with my coil and I won’t feel as apprehensive the next time it’s due to be changed.

readBy.name: Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership

title: Fantastic doctors
body: This practise is very quick to respond when you need to be seen. Very efficient booking system. Doctors listen, reassuring and are compassionate. Really highly recommend this practise. They are wonderful.

author: Jilhc47
title: The link up did not work very well
body:
I was referred by my GP to the Urgent Care Centre for an appointment for urgent x-ray and bloods. This link up did not work very well and although contacted by the urgent Care Centre very quickly took some persuasion to give me a timed appointment (as the GP had requested).  
But when I got the timed appointment for x-ray and bloods - all staff were amazing professional, kind, funny and helpful (from reception to doctors). Was seen on 2 consecutive days for test. Great service.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

title: Great Practice and compassionate from all staff
body: What an amazing compassionate service from everyone at Woolton Medical Centre from telephone call, reception to the GP visit to my mum at home. We recognise the Medical Centres work tirelessly and the compassion shown from the team is outstanding, we as a family feel they all care which reassures us. We can’t thank them enough for their outstanding values and care. Well done to everyone at Woolton Medical Centre Woolton Liverpool.

author: muscadk77
title: SET Kids club
body: The kids club in Downshire Hospital is a brilliant afterschool service. The staff go out of there way to help. My son loves kids club.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Peachy77
title: Cataract removal
body: Admission, processing, etc, all very good. Had to wait 4 hrs, though first to be admitted. Nurses were very attentive & friendly, which made procedure easier

title: Awful practice
body: Since covid this surgery has really been sub par. According to data you are still only operating 67% of appointments actually see a GP. How long can this carry on. It’s easier to go to A and E than try and get through on the telephone.

author: Shaz298
title: Fantastic service by the radiology team
body:
My 17-yr-old son who has additional needs and medical trauma was on the waiting list for an MRI and CT scan.  
He was offered a cancellation appointment for his MRI. The staff were kind, patient and very understanding of his needs and made sure he felt safe on the day. They allowed me to be with him during the scan and this helped enormously with his anxiety.  
Once finished, the technician said they'd noticed he was on the waiting list for a CT scan, too. They asked if we were in a rush, and if not we were welcome to wait and they'd get his CT scan done. We said thanks very much and waited for it to be done.  
Actually, the whole service with regards to his wonky knees has been excellent and reassuring, as it's our first venture into adult services after spending lots and lots of time in hospital or having appointments with various doctors over the years. Lots of those times were also very positive and we've been fortunate to have fantastic working relationships with many medical professionals from many disciplines. .  
After a recent (recurring) knee dislocation, my son was referred to the knee clinic. His appointment was just 3 weeks from the date of referral. And now 3 weeks later he's had both tests which were required. He's just waiting on his follow-up appointment now.  
With all the doom and gloom around and complaints about waiting times, I felt it was important to shine a light on this very positive experience we've recently had.  
Thank you.

title: Great Service
body: I called just after 8am and by 8:10am I had been booked in to see the GP by a very friendly lady. I arrived for the appointment and was seen by the doctor without delay. He was professional and really listened to what I had to say. I found everyone to be extremely kind and it felt like a premium service, which I have not experienced at other surgeries before. Thank you Rushden Medical Centre!

author: Laird33
title: Bad experience in A&E department.
body:
My husband has complex health problems including angina and mixed dementia. Following 3 days of frequent angina attacks, he had such pain late at night that NHS 24 ordered an ambulance to take him to A&E. It arrived after 1 hour and came from Coatbridge with a lovely team who were very caring and took him to A&E Larbert. He was seen by triage nurse quite soon at around 2am .  
After that, he was assigned to the waiting room, in his pyjamas still, until 6am in the morning. When we enquired when he might be seen, we were advised it would be another 3 hours minimum, as there were 7 patients ahead of us and all the cubicles were full.  
My poor husband had sat all night in a porter’s chair, sleepy and in pain. I had sat there with him. Another 3 hours was unimaginable. So, I took him home. He has continued to have the painful attacks and we have been able to book a telephone consultation with his GP in a week’s time.  
Surely this is not how to care for a person with angina and dementia, among other things?  
We have had a good service in the past, but this was a dreadful, anxiety provoking experience and a waste of time.

title: Caring team
body: I had to have a biopsy on my eye, I had no idea what was going to happen, but from moment entered department they explained everything to me, made sure I was OK from start of day, to the procedure and care before discharge. With clear information for what to do once discharged. all the staff could not have been more pleasant and friendly. I know if ever need anything else doing there I will be on good hands keep up the good work x

author: lynxfz99
title: Explained what would happen at every stage
body:
I attended the X-ray department at the RAH for diagnostic imaging. The procedure itself was invasive in nature, however every member of staff I came into contact with were absolutely wonderful.  
I would particularly like to mention Jessie. She approached me before the procedure and explained it in great detail and also explained what would happen at every stage of the process. When I was in the room having the scan, Jessie was with me and engaged in conversation to take my mind off what was happening. I felt much more at ease because I knew what to expect during the procedure because of Jessie's reassurance.Staff like Jessie are what make experiences of care so positive, and I'd be very grateful if she received recognition for her wonderful manner and evident care and compassion for others.

title: very professional and personable GP
body:
greeted by first name
not rushed, but prioritised in surgery intervention (jab) whilst reviewing HbA1c and BP - changed meds
usual good advice and more support offered

title: Good service
body: Had a bit of a hiccup with my appointment rang reception and it was sorted swiftly with a pleasant chat and explanation to receptionist

author: RMoore
title: Once things were moving we felt completely looked after
body:
We did have a long wait on the ward for induction.  During this time, we didn't have much staff 'attention'. Once things were moving though, we felt completely looked after and had midwives we had met before help us through the birth. 
We had an experienced midwife who supported us in our decisions and a third year student who was very competent and made us feel very at ease across the whole process. Due to the student, everything that was done was spoken through in detail so we felt very well informed. 
Everyone was so pleased and supportive that baby arrived with few complications which was very different to our first birth 2 years ago. Care after birth has been fantastic, lots of check ins and congratulations. I feel very positive about the experience and am going home feeling boosted and with little reservations. 
Thank you so much!

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

title: Not good
body: I’ve been in pain at least 24months eventually got through to reception by a phone back, then told I would get a call from a doctor, spoke to the doctor told to give it s bit longer see how it goes, already been over 2 years and getting worse, I have lower back ache struggle to walk and also sway from side to side not good tried getting in touch again today been on hold long long time no answer, unable to do online say’s ring in the morning I don’t think this surgery  can get much worse I’ve been let down and through listening to other people lot more have been let down sad really used to be one of the best not any longer. Maybe that is one of the reasons hospitals are so busy

title: Amazing
body:
Went in for an ENT surgery, nurses on bluefin ward were absolutely fantastic and reassuring, the consultant and anaesthetist were very informative and understanding. They were very kind and made the experience absolutely phenomenal. The nurses in recovery were also fabulous and very caring.

10/10!!

readBy.name: Western Sussex Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: ED13
title: SHSCT Birth at Home Team
body:
I had been attending the midwives in Daisy Hill Hospital throughout my pregnancy, however after commencing a Hypnobirthing course we considered a home birth due to the importance the environment plays during labour. I was not allowed to see the delivery suite in DHH and that was causing some level of worry as we did not know what to expect. At home, we could have the room set up as we wanted and that helped massively. I was over 30 weeks pregnant when we made the decision of having a home birth.  
The antenatal care that we received from the Birth at Home Team cannot be compared to anything. It is beyond amazing. It is completely person- centred, there is no rushing to get the appointment finished with and the personalities, care and attention of each individual team member, made our journey so special. The visits happened in the comfort of our home and the checks completed with baby were fantastic.  
My husband was worried about a home birth, wondering if it would be safe as there is no doctor in the home and what if things went wrong. In the initial visit from Paula and Sadie, they had provided us with their knowledge and experience that made us both feel safe and able to proceed with a home birth. The biggest relief was knowing that should I have needed to transfer into hospital, ambulance control and the midwifery unit were already notified at the beginning of my labour and therefore they would be expecting me.  
During my labour, Sadie and Lois were such a good source of support and we all had great craic also which made things easier. These ladies were by my side when I needed them and also left my husband and I in private at times. We had the most magical birth story and they both respected my birth plan. We are forever grateful to Sadie and Lois for helping us bring our baby girl safely into this world in the comfort of our own home.  
The postnatal care has also been phenomenal. Again, visits are person- centred, there is no rush, you feel empowered to ask questions and reassured by the extensive knowledge of the team. My husband and I cannot thank the Birth at Home team enough, they are only operating in the last year and we wish them every success in the future.  
I would encourage any woman or couple to at least consider a home birth. It might not be for everyone, but when you educate yourself on the less risks associated with home births and you become involved with this team, you can be assured that the care provided to you will be exceptional. Thank you to the full team and in particular Paula, Sadie and Lois. We will never forget you all.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Appalling !
body:
Waited for a telephone appointment.
Doctor had not read my notes, was asking me about why i had ask for the call.
Told her and she went over old results not the ones i ask for.
Then told me i had to make another appointment for a blood test , told her if she had read the notes she could have seen i already had an appointment.
Then she still had no idea what the problem was , i told her 3 times and then she kept saying i was shouting !
How do you make a doctor listen ?
Had absolutely no idea what i wanted and never even tried to help.
I told her 3 times what results i was supposed to be discussing…then she said they hadnt got the results !!!
The doctors had told me to make an appointment as they had the results which were abnormal, she said she hadnt got them.
Very detrimental to my health as now i have to make one again with someone else when i could have been starting treatment ‼️
Appalling .

author: Mark DN
title: Poor Hygiene at Monklands Hospital
body:
I would like to complain about the men’s toilet facilities at Monklands Hospital, North Lanarkshire . For the many visitors and outpatients there are just 2 urinals with one sink. My wife is in the hospital and I visit daily. This week there was no soap in the hand wash dispenser for 24 hrs. The next day I went to an admin office at 10 am and brought this to their attention. I was assured it would be dealt with immediately.  
When I used the facilities at lunch time, still no soap! I went back to the office to complain. By evening break there was soap, but this means that for at least 30 hrs no male visitor who used the loo washed his hands sufficiently.  
However, what has prompted me to write today is that now the automatic tap is not dispensing any more water than the barest trickle, and has been like this for over a day. Basic hand washing is surely the most basic of requirements for any toilet, let alone one at a hospital. All this money being spent on hand sanitiser, but no soap and water available ?!!!! What’s worse is the facility has a check sheet on the back of the door. Who is checking and what are they checking?  
With the need to prevent general infection, let alone COVID, I find this shocking.

author: Luckywiccan
title: I feel more positive now
body:
I turned up for my appointment early, and was taken by the nurse straight away. She was lovely, finished with the nurse and straight to the Dr, who listened to me, discussed several things - mainly the menopause and the many symptoms - and made a plan for going forward.  
I do feel more positive now that I will get back to where I was pre-menopause and the pandemic  
Well done.

author: Chico 57
title: Professional care to the highest order
body:
I was admitted to the Day Surgery Ward at the Queen Margaret Hospital in Dunfermline, Fife. My procedure was a repair to a right side Linguinal hernia.  
From the minute I walked into the ward until the minute I walked out, I had professional care to the highest order. All members of staff treated me with respect, they all had a caring and understanding approach to me as a patient, and carried out their respective duties accordingly.  
In my opinion, the NHS is the best medical institution in the world, and I’m proud to have contributed to this all my working life.  
My aftercare is ongoing, but I was given the best chance anyone could receive.

title: Good Doctors
body: Very caring, understanding and explains every details of any concerning issues.Doctors call back straight after any test done, blood, urine, blood pressure etc, to discuss the results and what action needs to be taken.

author: RTLS
title: Extra help and care given
body:
I had an appointment at Lincoln Hospital & I live in Louth, so I was given a lift to the hospital, with instructions to call for my lift when finished.  
Once I got in the hospital I had a major panic as I had not got my phone, I'd left it in the car🤦🏻‍♀️ This meaning I had no phone, no numbers & no bank card/money, so I had a major panic about what I'd do, how I'd get home! The lady/nurse on reception was so kind & caring to me and allowed me to use the hospital phone to ring my mobile (the only number I know!) - in hope my lift would hear it in the car, but no answer, so through my near 1 hr appointment, she told me she'd continue to call (which she did)  
While in my appointment, the nurse was so kind to calm me and she used my notes so I could ring my partner to ring up my lift to collect me.  
As I left the ward they both were so kind, insisting if I had any further trouble that I came back to them... And luckily my lift was there waiting for me.... I was so relieved as I had such high anxiety at the time.  
... The staff were polite, friendly & definitely went above & beyond and helped me so much, both in my incident and my appointment. So thankful to all.

author: Student at college
title: General about City and Hackney Recovery College
body: Very good college. Very supportive tutors. Very good courses, but should be longer

title: Appalling Service from Rude Receptionists
body: I'm a chronically ill, disabled, elderly person who's had numerous hospital admissions in the past 3 years, and regularly needs to see a GP face to face. However, most of the receptionists, in my personal experience, are extremely unhelpful in that regard, churlish, disrespectful, unprofessional and inconsiderate towards the patient; they belittle all my health problems, and make the registered GPs totally inaccessible to their patients, as we are always given the same negative response: there are no appointments available. It makes absolutely no difference whether I call at 8am when they open, or I go in person to the surgery; either way, I have to wait for ages (I've noticed that the receptionists have the terrible habit of chatting among themselves while ignoring the people waiting in a queue right in front of them!), only to be told the same thing: no appointments available, try again the next day. It's a never-ending vicious cycle!

title: Practice Nurses
body: I recently had a phone call with one of the nurses in the practice and I would like to say how kind and helpful she was, she really gave me a lot of time and came up with very helpful suggestions and a care plan.

title: Great doctors
body: I’ve been with the surgery for a few years now and I still hold them in high regard. Like many other places they’ve struggled to get back to “normality” since the pandemic and most appointments are held by phone, this is beneficial for me personally, however when required to be seen face to face there’s no issues with doing so. The doctors are patient, attentive and knowledgeable with what seems to be a genuine regard for your wellbeing.

author: Thankful daughter-in-law
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: TIA clinic
body: My mother and father-in-law - 90 and 88 respectively - attended the TIA clinic in CAH. They were full of praise for how slickly the clinic was managed and showing them how to get to the MRI, CT scanners this was much appreciated and made for a much better experience. They greatly appreciated getting medication in a timely fashion at the pharmacy, which allowed treatment to start immediately without having to navigate the GP system.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Thankful daughter-in-law
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: Anticoagulant clinic DHH
body: My mother and father- in- law 90 and 88 respectively - attended the anticoagulant clinic in DHH. They said the care and attention given by Roisin the pharmacist was superb. With a patient with a medical background there were plenty of questions and all were answered in a manner that made perfect sense. Although parking had been an issue in a busy DHH OPD , Roisin even offered to help to get car out of a tight spot. which was not needed but greatly appreciated all the same. It is wonderful that these patients can independently travel to their local hospital.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Fabulous
body:
Absolutely amazing service, super quick response times to e consults, friendly staff, doctors are amazing and very supporting, which unfortunately is quite rare these days due to the pressure on the NHS. I have been able to connect with my named GP so well and we have a great professional relationship which makes it so much easier to discuss my problems without feeling like a burden.

Absolute 10/10 GP surgery, would definitely recommend!!

title: Wonderful practise
body: So kind and helpful all staff and doctors especially as I'm  a new patient so improved on my last practise .thankyou

title: Really good practice
body:
Besides covid times were appointments had to be postponed, I have not had an issue with lakeside surgery. I always get a call back, if I call for appointments.
In my experience noone has ever been rude to me or discautious, they simply did their job. I can't ask for more than that.

When i speak to the DR's, i feel like they have listened to my concerns, I don't feel hurried. I also appreciated how the doctor was thorough last month and today when it came to new medication I was about to be prescribed.

The surgery is clean and in a great location. You go in, you get your treatment and you get out. (Well it's not a hotel).

title: Excellent service
body: I would like to say how wonderful this GP practise is.  From the beginning it is easy to get through, the receptionists are so helpful and friendly, you don’t have to wait ages to get an appointment, the doctors and nurses are professional and knowledgeable and most importantly you feel that you have been listened to.   Thank you so much.

title: The extra distance
body: Everyone’s time and dedication is excellent and much appreciated. Seems to way exceed what I hear happens in other practices and areas. Thank you all!

title: Great practice
body: Appointment with nurse Deirdre.  Very professional, has a very calming caring manner. The practice offers a variety of services appointments available either face to face or telephone.  I have found that by taking the time to learn how the practice operates if I have a medical issue that needs addressing I do not have a problem speaking with a doctor. I plan for my routine appointments in advance, make sure I ask who is the best person to deal with my issue example could a nurse deal with this for me. Keep up the good work.    Thank you for providing a great service in very difficult times.

author: ACF
title: Don’t feel like I’m listened to and not receiving the help I need.
body:
I don’t feel like I’m being listened to and understood by my psychiatrist. It feels like my mental health is downplayed and blamed on my autism and ADHD. I feel like this is then resulting in me not receiving the help and treatment I need.  
I’m really struggling with my mental health and it hurts so much inside to know I’m not being believed.  
There’s also other ongoing issues like difficulty getting in contact with the MHT and things not being followed up. I wish I had some point of contact like a care coordinator or CPN to help me with this because I’m really struggling with it.  
I had an appointment with a different Dr today who was honestly really lovely. But he wasn’t able to change my medication even though I was told I would receive the same level of care. The reason he gave was that the medication change has to be done by the consultant.  
This has really annoyed me because the MHT knew that I was going to be discussing other treatment options, so I don’t understand why I was given an appointment with someone who was unable to do that.  
Something he said that has really upset me was that the medication I asked about was for people who are severely depressed. That feels really invalidating because I’m feeling really depressed but yet they’re not acknowledging that.  
It feels like that what I’m feeling inside is not what they’re seeing on the outside. I don’t know if that’s because of my anxiety, I get really nervous talking to them. I think it could also be because of my autism, as I really struggle communicating what’s in my head, verbally. But I feel like that they should already be aware of that.

title: Brilliant service
body:
Super friendly receptionist, under 5
Minutes wait time from arrival to being seen. Very friendly practitioner and assistant, really reassuring and knowledgable. Haven’t had such a good experience at a medical apt in years. The people are godsends, what a brilliant practice.

title: Great doctors
body: I went to see a lady doctor that noticed I had a mole on my leg that she referred to the hospital straight away and I was told that if she didn’t of noticed it that it would of been life threatening so she has saved my life I just want to thank her so much my amazing angle as well as a doctor thank you again
